metadata.synopsis: In the aftermath of the battle in the colony, Jaheira reflects on next steps and officially asks to join our party.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Debug Book -> Set quest flags -> Act 2 -> SCE - Epilogue -> Set up good path -> Go off-path -> Block Florrick -> Start the debrief.

12.speaker: Jaheira
12.text: If you have business to conclude before we march, have it done.
12.context: NodeContext: Casually ticking off world-ending threats on her fingers

20.speaker: Jaheira
20.text: The road to Baldur's Gate is long.

51.speaker: Jaheira
51.text: Our enemies spread like rub-rot - treat one patch, and two more bloom in its place.
51.context: NodeContext: Casually ticking off world-ending threats on her fingers

27.speaker: Jaheira
27.text: An elder brain, bound by lost Netherese magic, with servants of the Dead Three holding the chain.
27.context: NodeContext: Casually ticking off world-ending threats on her fingers

1.speaker: Player
1.text: You almost seem like you're enjoying yourself.

13.speaker: Player
13.text: I'm having the time of my life.

40.speaker: Jaheira
40.text: It is good to savour the moment of victory - but pace yourself. Our fight is just beginning.

63.speaker: Jaheira
63.text: When we met, I was licking my wounds - an old bear with her leg caught in the hunter's snare.

16.speaker: Jaheira
16.text: Now, I've slipped free of the trap and rediscovered my claws.

41.speaker: Jaheira
41.text: It's time for me to hunt my prey.

32.speaker: Jaheira
32.text: You have a Netherstone, and you're on the scent of two more.

26.speaker: Jaheira
26.text: These Chosen have reason to fear you - and I would like to be at your side when you confront them.

0.speaker: Jaheira
0.text: The city needs me - the Harpers know their tasks.

57.speaker: Jaheira
57.text: And I know my calling. I thought my grand adventures were behind me, but I should have known better.

30.speaker: Player
30.text: Of course. I already told you - you're welcome in my party.

21.speaker: Jaheira
21.text: Falling foul of Ketheric convinced me that my grand adventures were behind me - that even if I survived, I should hang up my blades.
21.context: NodeContext: Wry, little mock bow - not intended as sarcastic, just a callback to how she would take orders in previous games.

3.speaker: Jaheira
3.context: NodeContext: Wry, little mock bow - not intended as sarcastic, just a callback to how she would take orders in previous games.

8.speaker: Jaheira
8.text: We ventured into darkness together - now we've come out the other side, I'd say I'm feeling a little refreshed.
8.context: NodeContext: Wry, little mock bow - not intended as sarcastic, just a callback to how she would take orders in previous games.

48.speaker: Jaheira
48.text: When we reach Baldur's Gate, there will be even darker paths to tread. I will follow you wherever they lead.
48.context: NodeContext: Wry, little mock bow - not intended as sarcastic, just a callback to how she would take orders in previous games.

60.speaker: Player
60.context: NodeContext: Wry, little mock bow - not intended as sarcastic, just a callback to how she would take orders in previous games.

18.speaker: Jaheira
18.text: You're amply reinforced already. I'll let the new blood do all the running around, for now.
18.context: NodeContext: Wry, little mock bow - not intended as sarcastic, just a callback to how she would take orders in previous games.

62.speaker: Jaheira
62.context: NodeContext: Wry, little mock bow - not intended as sarcastic, just a callback to how she would take orders in previous games.

9.speaker: Jaheira
9.text: How does it compare to a shadow-cursed inn?

52.speaker: Jaheira
52.text: With the Absolute's army gone, the Risen Road should be clear - we can follow it all the way to Baldur's Gate.

61.speaker: Jaheira
61.text: There's a Harper safe-house in Wyrm's Crossing - Danthelon's Dancing Axe. We'd do well to check in with them before entering the city proper.

38.speaker: Jaheira
38.text: Beyond that, our course is yours to set. Find me at your camp. I can remember how to take orders, as well as give them.

10.speaker: Jaheira
10.text: Beyond that, our course is yours to set. I can recall how to take orders, as well as give them.

50.speaker: Player
50.text: On second thought - no, Jaheira. Best we part ways.

53.speaker: Jaheira
53.text: Your way is my way, just as your fight is my fight. But suit yourself.

7.speaker: Jaheira
7.text: One awkward evening in camp, until we are free of this place. And then you will be free of me.

59.speaker: Jaheira
59.text: You ventured into the heart of darkness when I could not.

22.speaker: Player
22.text: I'll be glad to have you by my side.

11.speaker: Player
11.text: I don't think so, Jaheira. Go your own way.

4.speaker: Player
4.text: I've got a parasite in my brain - makes it hard to enjoy anything.

28.speaker: Jaheira
28.text: You came here in search of a cure, but found a conspiracy instead - I can see how that would be disheartening.

56.speaker: Jaheira
56.text: But take courage - we have killed a man who could not die, and stripped the Absolute's army of its general.

34.speaker: Player
34.text: You've tangled with the Dead Three before?

2.speaker: Jaheira
2.text: Extensively. Mind flayers too - but I never dreamed of seeing gods and illithids working in consort.

14.speaker: Player
14.text: Spent a lot of time in mind flayer colonies, have you?

36.speaker: Jaheira
36.text: More than anyone should. But I never dreamed I'd see the Dead Three working in consort with illithids.
